text: @MrKhronicz¬† how can a ant from a race of an infinitude of ants perceive humans? what they are, what they do, and why they do those things? now clearly you think of yourself as an intelligent person, and I hope you are or else this will be a waste of both our times. Now human created amazing things. things ants will never achieve or even be aware of. ants to humans is like humans to god. If he can create everything, consciousness included, how can us ants even begin to understand him? theres no way to prove god, but theres also no way to disprove him, the only ones that could tell the truth are past our reach, but lucky for us, one day we'll join their company, and we will share the truth. Will it be nothingness? Darkness? or something we could never imagine? Thats irrelevant, all that matter is what do you believe, because that just might make the difference. I'm a logical guy, I look for signs, I'm not the stereotypical christian that blindly follows anyone. But I can feel good and evil inside of me like I can feel a weight on my back or a cold brewing in my sinuses. science doesn't believe in good and evil, it believes in nature and coincidences. It talks of perfect conditions to breed and world where life was formed and evolved and survived, all by chance. Christians believe in a plan, a reason for it all. So the question is, do believe in coincidences or do believe theres a purpose/significance? Thanks for reading this monologue, i tried to keep it as exciting as possible. PS religion doesn't negate science. like i said I'm a logical guy, theres fools in both categories, some christians fight science for that reason, they're fools, some athiests are fools as well. Science is simply humans way to perceive the world around them. its the way we categorize and understand it, science is just another definition, we have thousands of those in the dictionary, religion is definition too. And to answer your last question, I think gods plan is to test us, whenever humans make something we test it to see how it works. For him to take our free will away proves nothing, letting us make our own choices is significant. For what I can't say. But is a bearded man in the sky anymore absurd than an explosion from nothingness that created by chance to the nth power a perfect world to support us that led us on a billion year journey to this very moment where you're reading this monologue about the possibility of that very explosion from nothingness?
author: MrShloker

text:
@MrShloker¬†I'm going to throw in with the other guy here. The whole "we can't perceive God" thing is a bit silly. It's just an assumption that isn't based on any facts whatsoever. I'd also like to point out that God needn't be disproved until he is proved in the first place. I use this saying quite often: "that which can be asserted without evidence can be dismissed without evidence."

I'd like to touch on your last thought as well. You seem to think that the conditions on our planet (and in the universe itself) are incredibly rare. That's very understandable, seeing as we don't have much to base these things on. But you are making the mistake of underestimating the sheer size of the universe. The entirety of space has been expanding for about 13.8 billion years. That's a very long time. There is a whole lot of matter with which to form stars and planets. To think that life is exclusive to Earth is absurd. We have a general idea of how life can be formed. We know for a fact how it can be diversified. More recently, we've discovered an incredible amount of planets that could potentially support life. You must also keep in mind that life on Earth is made up of the most common elements in the universe. It's not crazy to think that life is common given this information, is it? It would be a different story if we were made of tungsten or something. I've probably bored you at this point, so I'll save you the trouble of having to read my horribly inarticulate thoughts-turned-text any longer. I hope I gave you something to ponder. Have a nice day!

@MrShloker¬†Yes, I think it's quite clear that you've not actually bothered to read my comment, at all.

Can you please answer this question, WITHOUT having to go into detail about assumptions based on what the Bible says or talking about ants and stuff.
To say Humans are to Ants as God is to Humans is so wrong.

For one, ant species that have eyes, can see if if we dig them out there homes, ants may not have created the things humans have, but they are certainly the most advanced insect species in all the world, bee's come in second.

I said, IF God exists.
Why did he create a Universe in which life is so horrible, why did he create disease and pain?
Why does he inflict newborn babies with terminal illnesses?
Why does he let billions of people starve?
Why does he allow violence and war in his name?
And furthermore, how do you know God is real? The Muslims say that Allah is real, the Greeks said that their Gods were real, the Egyptians said that there Gods were real, the Romans, the Hindu's, the Sikhs, they all claim that their God's are the true God's. So what is it about the Christian God that makes you, so sure, that he is real?

I'll repeat my comment in a way you can understand. The ONLY thing I want you to answer.

*If God is real and he has infinite power.
Why does he not solve humanity's unsolvable problems?
Why did he not create an existence in which these problems cannot happen?*

You have 3 answers to choose from.

1. The Bible lied and God doesn't have infinite power.
2. The Bible is a lie entirely and God doesn't even exist.
or
3. God does exist, he has infinite power, but he hates humanity so he sits by and watches us perish day by day.

Whichever one of those fits you, lemme know.

text:
@MrShloker‚Äã Hello. Just to add to the discussion: if struggle is a test from God, why are some people's lives so much worse than other people's? Why is do some people have to struggle with natural disasters, starvation, disease, etc, when others have a perfectly good life and a great upbringing? Surely that's injustice; an unfair and inaccurate test of human adequacy? Also, if God is omniscient, why would he have to test us at all, seeing as he can already forsee the results? Surely it's unnecessary pain? Additionally, wouldn't there be ways, in an unimaginable spectrum of possibility that is unlimited by experience, to test out morals without unnecessary suffering? If God is omnipotent, I'm sure s/he could come up with some way or another. 

Furthermore, progressing onto more uneven terrain, if God is omniscient, and therefore knows what our choices are going to be beforehand, that eliminates our ability to make a different decision in any situation, therefore eliminating our free will, and making the 'test' pointless to begin with.

Moreover, seeing as the existence of God gives us purpose and meaning in life, and the lack thereof ultimately is much more difficult to live with psychologically, as it devalues us, surely we would be in a position of bias in declaring that God exists without evidence, as we have a reason to want to believe that.

As well as this, if God did exist, why would he create us in a way that would make us subjectable to 'sin'? In response to the existence of good and evil as seperate entities to science to support the existence of God, I believe that the morals do exist in coordination with science: they exist to enable us to survive better as a species. 

What do you think?Ôªø

text:
@MrShloker I didn't express atheism, nor religion. I did not say that I agreed with the arguments that I presented, nor that they were correct, nor that it would make me more intelligent than another individual if they were so. I was simply expressing another perspective, as I'm genuinely interested in religion and the different arguments for and against, so I was interested in your response. I am not attempting to impose my ideals on you, and I'm really sorry if I appeared angry or confrontational, (as from your response it seems as you might have found it) - I honestly didn't intend it that way.

To continue to play devil's advocate, in a way, in response to your argument: if God is so far from our conception, why do we attempt to label or categorise him/her at all? Why do people claim that God is omnipotent, or omniscient, or at least not all-loving, as that would be an assumption of his/her motives and nature, and inevitably be contradictory? If we believe, shouldn't we just step back and get on with our lives, instead of making assumptions? Just another possibility, and again, I apologise if I appeared confrontational or offensive. :)

text:
@MrShloker¬†@MrKhronicz¬†As for the whole "ants to humans, humans to god" analogy, I fucking hate ants, and I crush their anthills if they're in my path. I do so with no greater purpose, fuck ants.

Now, let's talk hmm? No I didn't read your entire post mainly because your grammar is atrocious, but I've heard every argument from here to Nazareth and I've seen the first part of Zeitgeist like five times so let's do this.

I used to believe in god! When I was like six, and I had a whole crew of imaginary friends who brought me presents and candy. Oh, and pro wrestling, too! Those were the good old days. Then one year I found all my Christmas presents in my parent's closet a few weeks prior to Christmas, and in the next few months everything collapsed. Santa wasn't real, Easter Bunny was a fraud, and that damn lying Tooth Fairy... So wait, why the fuck are we still saying grace? God didn't put this food on our table I literally watched you go to work, you were gone all day, and then you bought that fucking turkey! I saw it! Why does god get the credit? He didn't assemble depth-finders for 8 hours in a sweaty warehouse in downtown Shakopee and he didn't go grocery shopping for us! That's akin to North Koreans thanking Kim Jong-Un for their meals! Except, you know, without the nukes.

Now for a more somber note. I can't remember exactly how old I was (I believe I was between 12 and 14) the last time I prayed. I was laying in bed in my room bawling my eyes out. I had just received my midterm report card complete with four Fs and a D, which normally sounds like a fun night out but it prompted my father to call me, and I quote, worthless. So as I'm laying there crying about how right he was I decided to pray, because fuck it nothing else was working. I prayed and all I asked for was some kind of sign, literally, anything that could straight up tell me It would be okay. Seriously anything. A bird could have flown into my window and smashed his face I would have found it hilarious and I probably would have felt better. My mom could have just popped her head in and said "It''s going to be okay". Nah. I got nothing. I got more silence and darkness. I went upstairs later my parents just glared at me. That's the day my faith completely died.

I'll admit my initial turn to atheism was out of spite. Bad stuff happened to me and I blamed god because everyone said he loved me and all that jazz, but then I started to actually learn stuff about Christianity. The stories are absolute bullshit. The book is just a million metaphors that boil down to "don't be a dick". Finally, the entire bundle of concepts that is "god/satan/heaven/hell" is the PERFECT ANSWER to the MOST ASTRONOMICALLY HUGE QUESTION IN EXISTENCE and I find that so impossible that us tiny insignificant humans would be able to find that answer and even be partially right. The question, by the way, is a combo of "why are we here, and where will we go after this?". Also, when I say perfect answer, I mean it's exactly what you would want to hear! "Come on down to Christianity everybody! We've got everything you'll ever need! A loving and tender god! A place where the good go to live happily! And a place with a special demon to punish all those wrong-doers you hate!"

I feel like I barely got my point across but this is YouTube for fucks sake I'm not writing an essay here.
author: Shane Bennis

text:
@Shane Bennis¬†Addendum (Is that the right word here?)

I don't want to outright claim that there's no such thing as "a god" it just depends on how you define that. If you believe in the Christian God, you are a misguided fool and I'm sorry I had to call you that just now. Although I accept the possibility that our Universe, or rather the events that created it, may have been set in motion by a "higher power" from beyond this realm. I mean, shit, that doesn't even sound that far-fetched compared to the shit some UFO enthusiasts say. Although, I honestly find it completely illogical to say that this being, who would have to be so unfathomably more advanced than us, would love and care or even give the slightest shred of a shit about us. Going back to the "ants to humans, humans to god" analogy. Nobody gives a shit about ants. There's billions of them, they're fucking everywhere, some of them bite, we put them in farms and stare at them, we make molds of their colonies with molten aluminum killing them all. If anything, we hate ants. Ants to humans, humans to god.

Stop trying to personify God. You say these things as if God is a mystical man who lives in the sky and knowingly creates different aspects of life. That is a very naive perception of God, you attribute all these humanistic like actions/qualities/emotions like create, love, spite.¬†

God just is, God is infinite, time can't have a beginning or end. Our brains aren't capable of comprehending such infinitely complex concepts. That is the hardest part for us humans to cope with, we want to comprehend so we argue and debate all these principles of who/what is God. Just know this, there's a reason why you exist right now and it can't be explained how or why and it never will be. Stop trying comprehend that which is impossible to comprehend. Spread love, peace, and positivity in this life and let the rest take care of itself, you could search every second of your life looking for answers to these types of questions and never find them so don't work yourself up over them.

text:
If you've participated in an athletic discipline, you would know the kind of love God has for us. In track and field, you might have a coach who encourages you to be better, despite he yells at you and constantly implies you can do better. The thing is that it isn't the coach that makes you better, but it's yourself. And once you want to be a better you, the coach can help you make a better you, because that's what he's for. And when you see your better you, you can thank your coach, because along with your pushing yourself, the coach gave his judgment to you to try to do better and run past your own limitations.
I will never forget my coach telling me, "I'm not teaching you to run without pain. I'm teaching you to run through the pain". He also encouraged the team to "not do it for your friends, or your family, or even me. Do it for yourself!" Again, I repeat, the coaches are there to help you make a better you. The victory is to both you and the coach if you pushed yourself.

This is the kind of love God has for you and I. You've been given challenges ever since you were born. Complaining doesn't do anything for you, now does it? Denying your coach right in front of you?
I would hope that the Spirit enlightens you to understand the love of God one day.

text:
@MrKhronicz¬†Hey, I just thought I would slip in a quick comment here. That question is a big question and would take much text to answer and you probably would not get a whole answer. I would encourage you to read "Is God a Moral Monster?" by Paul Coplan. Although I don't think he answers perfectly to every topic he overviews but it may help you understand.

With that being said, I would like to give you a quick answer to your question. This happens because God loves us. Yes that sounds kind of stupid right? Imagine if I were to say, "I love you; here are the Measles". You would think, what a freak!

You see, in the beginning, God created the earth and everything on it and said that is was GOOD. Now because he loved us, He gave Adam and Eve a choice. If a robot is programmed to love, is it really love? Can you make your child love you? can you make your crush love you? how about at gun point? is it love or is it pressure? You see God gave a choice, To be near to him or to be far from him. But, sadly, Adam and Eve were tempted and chose to disobey the one who had Created. Now, if God is perfection then the polar opposite is chaos, disorder and imperfection. The world has fallen, the earth is getting worse, the climate is becoming more and more poor, birth defects are becoming even more regular. All because this world has been made ungood through our choice. As a side note to another part of your question, God does not create babies, they are a product of a fallen world and the two individuals who came together to conceive the child. 

But the good news. God, because he wouldn't just abandon his creation that he loved, He sent his perfect, sinless son, Christ, (Himself). The almighty creator sacrificed his own fleshly body on the cross as a covering for our abandoning of him. to invite us back to where there is perfection. We must only choose. This world will then pass away and a new heaven and a new earth, where non of those troubles pester us, will then replace it. But, because he loves us he wants to give everyone the opportunity, but if he forced you, would that be love?

I hope this helps you to understand, even if only a little.

text: How could you imagine a loving god that lets babies and young children die horribly painful deaths? Or lets millions of people slowly starve to death through no fault of their own? How do you justify that? For that, you would need to convince yourself, against all reason, that there must be some "higher purpose" to all of this misery..... Or, you can come to terms with the only two... ok three, options afforded to us by logic; God is a total prick, God doesn't care about life, God does not exist. That's it.
author: Nick Amodio

text: @Nick Amodio¬†Or if we want to actually do a philosophical debate the other option in the non-existent section of your argument is that somewhere along the line an omnipotent force determined true freedom is to allow its creation to play itself out, at least in most ways. If we remove everything negative then we simply live as robots in the matrix. No differing ideas, no culture, no need to gain anything by helping anyone because no one ever needs it. Life becomes pointless. How can we really discuss a higher being and its decisions. Maybe God is just a 7th dimensional energy field we can't ever understand that permeates our existence. You can't disprove it, but quantum evidence backs up that theory and I just made it up.
author: Chr0maticAttack

text: Good job on trying to make your point by shoving the argument on other people.  When trying to make a point, it generally works better to use logic and evidence to support yourself, as opposed to trying to say that there isn't evidence to deny your point, because you could, in fact, run into someone with a bit of logic and a bit of research to completely turn your argument around.
author: Jackson Warren

text: @Jackson Warren¬†Except I made a broad philosophical statement then simply responded to another's argument with a possible breakdown of ideas of my own. What logical 'evidence' can one even bring forth in such broad metaphysical/philosophical discussions? There is only room for discussion, and the occasional 1/1,000,000 piece of the puzzle (Higgs Boson/Field). We don't even have the Big Bang anymore in case you keep up with scientific journals on astrophysics. The magnetic fields and energy we expected to detect were found to be false...so back to square one on the most fundamental scientific exploration we base everything on.¬†http://xxx.lanl.gov/abs/astro-ph/0302273 ...I do have evidence, I just don't think it was required in the prior discussion. Here's a new one.

text:
Riiight....because it makes perfect sense that God would inherently punish every single person because of the sins of Adam and Eve. So I would be damned to Hell for something I didn't even do (Original Sin), unless I admit and proclaim that God punished someone else for that sin (Jesus/Himself)? By saying 'Jesus died for my sins'. While also punishing himself for my own sins (Because of the absurd Trinity notion) So now he is punishing one person/himself for the sins of everyone? And if we don't admit this, then we are still screwed by that Original Sin? Which is punishing everyone for the sins of Adam and Eve? That's laughable.

It's unbelievable how people like yourself consider this to be the stance of a just, fair God. So no matter what I do in my life, my sins, my good deeds, none of that really matters, because Adam and Eve sinned thousands of years ago? That sounds like a rather heinous, spiteful, grudge-bearing, irrational, unjust, unrelenting God....Original Sin and Salvation through Christ is nothing more than a ploy used to sway the people of that era.¬†

If someone came into your house 2am, snatched you out of bed, tossed you in a cell on death row awaiting execution, and you finally get an answer to your question as to why, by being told "Well, your great-great-great grandfather broke a law...so you are going to have to be punished now, by being tortured mercilessly. But wait! The judge said that there is a way you can get out from this! He said he will punish his son (and himself...as if that makes sense) for the crime, and you can go free! You just have to tell everyone about it. And not only that! He will give you a get out of jail free card, so you won't ever have to be punished...not for your ancestors crime, and not for your own crimes! ¬†All you have to do is tell people about it!"¬†
You would probably respond with "So basically, no matter what I do in my life...I'm automatically damned, unless I follow your philosophy, and then i'll automatically be blessed? So I guess this means that now I can go kill, rob, rape, and do whatever, now that I will be given eternal life and rewarded with Heaven...all I have to do is just say Jesus died for me."¬†

If a teacher promised her entire class an A+ for the final grade, what makes you think her students are going to study or even crack open a book? ¬†

If that scenario seems absurd and something that would never be acceptable in our society, as humans, what makes you think God would follow those same guidelines?
It's absolutely ludicrous for those same principles to exist in society...why the fuck would you see that as fair when it has to do with eternity.
I don't know about you, but I'd rather worship a God who will judge me based on my own sins, my own good deeds, my own actions. Not a God that would hold a grudge against me for something I didn't even do, or punish one for all, or all for one. The philosophy of Original Sin and Salvation is nothing more than a recruitment tool used to increase followers, by scaring them into believing that they will be damned if they don't, no matter if they lived righteously or gracefully, while also telling them that they will be rewarded, regardless, by just claiming Salvation in Christ.¬†

There is only one God worthy of worship. He has no partners, no equals, no relatives. My standing in the afterlife won't be conditional on another human being. Not Adam. Not Eve. Not Jesus.¬†

text:
i think saying he has a "better life" really isn't fair when we're talking about such a devastating disease. but i totally get your broader point. those of us who seem "normal" aren't forgiven our flaws in the same way as when we can claim to have a medical condition.
just today, the thought crossed my mind that each time an aspect of the human condition is medicalized, there is an implicit understanding that that aspect is no longer fair game for harsh judgment or ridicule. depression was not taken seriously by many people before it was "a thing". its appropriate medicalization paved the way for empathy and understanding for those with the condition.
i'm not in favor of medicalizing each aspect of the human condition. what is in the range of normal should still be considered normal. but even normal conditions could do with the same immunity from harsh judgment, blame and ridicule as is granted only to conditions that have been declared a medical illness.

text: @Luke47895¬†You and I both (Or at least, I ASSUME you do.) know that this world is fucked anyway because of the poison you've just mentioned. A meaningless existence means nobody will miss or lose you if you die early. And chances are, somebody with a meaningless existence had nothing they wanted to do before death. They can't lose anything, or fail to achieve something on their bucket list. People say it's better to have loved and lost than to have never loved at all. But to me, that's a lie. Never having loved means you don't regret losing them, or miss that feeling. But loving and losing that person makes you suffer more than depression can. It can drive you to fucking INSANITY. Losing things that you hold dear to you harms you. Not having anything to lose makes you unable to be harmed by losing something.

text: @JayfeatherFan1000¬†Well yeah I can somewhat agree on that things are pretty much fucked. But doesn't mean we can't try to make the best of the time we have now. It's a combination of good and bad and unfortunately the bad often tips the scales. The last thing you say about losing things or I assume you mean people that are close to you. Again that's partly true but I honestly would rather take the chance and form a relationship with someone. Whether it be a partner, relative or a friend. The way I look at life is I try to do what's best for the people closest to me and be polite to other as often as I'm permitted to and just try to be as genuine and honest as I can. Truth is life is difficult no matter where you come from. It's all about making the best out of what you have and enjoy the good times as often as you can because our time alive is limited.¬†

text: @WiteRastaNinja Since you asked, the bait is your laughable ignorance of coupling the words "agnostic" with "atheist." No one could expect you to understand God or even pursue Him when you dont even understand the words you are using. I also dont think atheists are predisposed to being unhappy for the fact that they are ignorant to the existence of God. On the contrary, I used to be one and I was quite happy wallowing in sin and lawlessness. And for your further enlightenment, I dont pray in church. I dont even go to church. My relationship with God has little to do with the common empty ritualistic ideas of commercial church going. Following those ideas, I can understand why "atheists"¬† slam religion so much. That and the general hypocrisy practiced by mainstream Christians and its no wonder the ignorant people such as yourself, react they way that you do. But I'll let you know, as sure as there are people on the intellectually low side of atheism, their counterparts being hypocrite Christians, there are intellectually astute atheists as well, their counterparts being Christians such as I, who dont just believe that there is a God, but KNOW there is a God because of actual supernatural encounter. And yes, it does give me a sense of morality. Without Jesus Christ, I would have continued in the same self convenient sense of morality that you have. You should take notice next time youre in a morally questionable situation faced with a decision to do the right thing and see how many excuses you come up with to justify doing the wrong thing. The difference between me and you is that I would hope to do the right thing even when it was a disadvantage to me or even hurt me, every time. I do this because of God. God IS morality and atheists think they dont need God to be moral. Its a laugh. God invented morality and anybody who thinks they dont need God for morality is just riding on His coat tails. Where do you think your parents and our society got their sense of moral values? The answer is Christianity. So now that we are cutting God out of our lives more and more with each passing generation, we can see a pattern developing that cannot be argued with; our moral fabric is disintegrating.

text: @cuberandgamer Cube, I think you missed something. First of all, having a relationship with Jesus is much more than praying. It is also about study of biblical principles and formulas and applying them to your life. It's about living with daily intention to change your character to reflect the will of the savior. I understand what you are saying and I can identify with it. I also can identify with atheism, which was the final stage of my lack of spirituality before I got saved. And when I say I got saved, I'm not talking about the empty alter call situation that they perform at every conclusion of mainstream protestant church services. My moment of salvation came when I was alone. To make a long story short, I actually had a supernatural encounter with the Holy Spirit. Up until that point I had not really believed in God and always had this reservation in my heart about wanting God to prove He was real. After my experience I have never looked back and I continue to seek a relationship with Him daily. Jesus is real. It's really fantastic. You must go back and search for Him again. But your heart must be pure and sincere. He knows your heart. The only one you can fool is yourself. If you love the world more than God and are not willing to give your life to Him, He will know it, even if you don't.

text:
@Justice Mars¬†Just being agnostic is a cop out. There are two different kinds of agnostics, there are agnostic theists (who lean toward the possibility of a celestial being but accept that there may not be one) and agnostic atheists (agnostics that lean towards the probability of there not being any kind of deity, but leave room for the possibility).¬†

I do not believe that you need a god to make moral decisions. There are plenty of examples of theists making questionable decision. But the fact is that statistically speaking atheists are less likely, overall, to commit a crime. Myself being an atheist, like to think that I make good decisions. I pay my taxes, I donate to the poor, I love animals, and I care for human life. We developed morality out of necessity for survival as a species. It is more favorable to feel empathy for your species because it perpetuates it. That is if you believe in evolution.¬†

@Eduardo Beguelin Jara¬† Your assumption that if you stop believing then you never were in a legitimate relationship with Him, is definitely incorrect like you say. This is because you have been blinded by evil, tricked into making you feel like Jesus is unnecessary in your life. This has caused many Christians to turn their backs on God and follow Satan's path of destruction willingly and with confidence without knowing it.

An answer to your question on whether or not eternal life is realistic can be found through God's word and His teaching¬† through His son Jesus Christ. I can state to you now that eternal life is not a "magical" myth, considering all the miracles God and Jesus performed on people's lives were in fact supernatural happenings themselves. There is a reason that God gave up His only son to die for us! An opportunity for us to grasp eternal life with Him in heaven through the forgiveness of our sins.

All those "Christians" who say you never were are "true" Christian cannot judge you like that. You know yourself if you were or not. These people who judge your connection with Him are in fact not "true" Christians themselves!

If you choose to be a Christian or not, God has given you the choice. If you turn down God's blessing it is like turning down life itself! Evil will consume your thoughts and actions, causing you to do things without even noticing it!

Now I am not saying you cannot be a good person without Jesus, you are just not complete with Him, under His divine spiritual protection.

I do hope you realise that God back in your life will make you so much happier and fulfilled. Why wait till you are about to die? That is just another way of saying that you only want His gift and not a relationship with Him.

I do hope you reconnect your relationship with Jesus, as well as all the other people who don't have a relationship with Him. Love you bro, Jesus loves you :)

text:
@Nokty 
I already wrote that in the end the term makes no difference. Call it whatever you want, you're simply avoiding the real discussion. How is that?

While you did say calling it fluke is wrong, you did NOT provide another term. 
The term "fluke" makes no sense in its very essence as - with enough data and the correct formulas - you could foresee everything. And that is why you can - under an evolutionary premise - in fact say it was a fluke.

What you are talking about is micro evolution, as in, certain inheritances that change over the generations. A macro evolution, meaning the creation of a new sense, for example an eye, has never been noted. By the way, Darwin said he could not imagine something as complex as an eye to come to exist through a fluke. 

I however do not doubt the evolution as much as you think I do.

I would like to know where your understanding of how a theory is seen among scientists. It is easy to state something like that.
It contradicts with what people I know or discussed with said.

text:
@CHAOTIXBLADE 

While I really don't feel like it right now and while I've written this about ten times already, here we go:

Dante's divine Comedy is said to be the most influential book of the medieval times, only topped of course, by the bible. But still, this pagan's book altered hell for ever. The first image of hell we have in mind is that of Dante Alighieri. 

Before that, the associations with hell were very different. Actually, what has been translated as hell was not even one, but three words: Sheol, Hades and, if I recall it correctly, Gehenna. Just to show how much has changed. 

Dante's version of hell wasn't based upon the actual source, it was a free interpretation of how Dante thought hell would be.

And now to the actual argument: I believe that, should a person want to leave hell, he could. However, all that the person wants is to sin: he wants to take drugs, he wants to have sex and so on. The sins that filled his life are still with him in his death, and since he doesn't accept God's help because he wants the sin instead, he is trapped in his very own hell forever.

That is also explains how hell is worse for one than another since a person that craves for more obviously lacks and thus suffers more. 
Even if God (and I believe he does) were to offer him paradise, he would deny it as he only sees the sin.

text:
@Joe c¬†Ok then. I know your just going to copy my comments and criticize them, so here we go.

Manuscript Evidence:
1. The bible has been around for thousands of years. It is still one of the largest religions in the world. The human race isn't stupid. They know we didn't come from apes after a cosmic lightbulb lit up. Btw, Darwinism began in about 1860 or so... So let's see... thousands of years or 154... such a decision, right? @Joe c¬†

¬†Internal Evidence
1.'If the world hates you, keep in mind it hated me first. If you belonged to the world, it would love you as its own. As it is you do not belong to the world. That is why the world hates you"
- Jesus
The evidence for the authority of the Bible falls into two major categories: internal evidence and external evidence. I mean by internal evidence, the evidence that is found within the Bible itself. By external evidence, I mean evidence that is found outside the Bible, such as archaeology, science, philosophy, and ancient manuscripts. Let us first consider the former, the internal evidences.
Self-proclamation

The first fact is that the Bible claims to be the Word of God. The authors knew they were writing the words of God, even though they often did not fully understand what they were writing. 2 Timothy 3:16 states, "All scripture is inspired by God." 2 Peter 1:21 states, "No prophecy was ever made by an act of human will but men moved by the Holy Spirit spoke from God." Jesus himself viewed the Old Testament as authoritative and quoted from it throughout his ministry.

Holy Spirit

Second, the Holy Spirit confirms to us that the Bible is the Word of God. John 16:13 states, "But when He, the Spirit of truth comes, He will guide you into all truth." The Holy Spirit who convicts the world of sin also assures the believer that the Bible is God's Word.

Transforming Ability

Third, we have evidence concerning the transforming ability of the Bible. Hebrews 4:12 says, "The word of God is living and active and sharper than any two-edged sword, and piercing as far as the division of soul and spirit." Romans 12:2 says, "And be not conformed to this world but be transformed by the renewing of your mind." The Word of God and the Spirit of God actually transforms the lives of people. The Bible has changed the lives of murderers, drug addicts, top government officials, business people, and students, to name just a few people from every walk of life who have been transformed by the Bible. No other book can make such a claim. This is because the Bible is not a mere book on good living but is literally packed with power. It is the Word of God with the power to change lives.

These are only three internal evidences supporting the authority of the Bible. ( That doesn't belong to me, it belongs to Pat Zukeran)
¬†
Historical Evidence
( this one's easy )
1. GRAVITY
¬†God stated That "the world was held by nothing" which meant gravity (can't see gravity) Before that, non-believers figured the world was held up by something- a man, a catfish, even a turtle. Know what happened? BAAAM proven wrong even before they thought they were proven right.¬†

Now, that is barely picking at the surface of God's existence and yet I have made some pretty good points on atheism that many atheists don't want to admit. I never said God hated you. God doesn't hate anyone, he cries when we sin. He cries because He knows if we don't straighten up we'll be arguing in Hell. Whatever. Believe what you want to believe and I'll believe what I want to. We will know what happens to both of us in the end

text:
@Ed Albert¬†Well, if you read the Bible, which I assume you didn't but if you did, then you would learn from it that disease and death came into the World through the sin of man which separated man from God. ¬†The bible teaches that he created man perfect and gave him free will. ¬†The first ones sinned against him and had offspring that inherited the sin nature. ¬†This event brought death, suffering and disease. ¬†God then offers hope from the death, suffering and disease.¬†

That's what the bible teaches. ¬†It doesn't teach what you said. ¬†That God created man with disease. ¬†You don't have to believe it but you should at least be educated on what it teaches rather than misrepresenting it with the intention to discredit it. ¬†

"My argument against God was that the universe seemed so cruel and unjust. But how had I got this idea of just and unjust? A man does not call a line crooked unless he has some idea of a straight line. What was I comparing this universe with when I called it unjust? If the whole show was bad and senseless from A to Z, so to speak, why did I, who was supposed to be part of the show, find myself in such violent reaction against it? A man feels wet when he falls into water, because man is not a water animal: a fish would not feel wet. Of course, I could have given up my idea of justice by saying that it was nothing but a private idea of my own. But if I did that, then my argument against God collapsed too--for the argument depended on saying that the world was really unjust, not simply that it did not happen to please my private fancies. Thus in the very act of trying to prove that God did not exist--in other words, that the whole of reality was senseless--I found I was forced to assume that one part of reality--namely my idea of justice--was full of sense. Consequently atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning: just as, if there were no light in the universe and therefore no creatures with eyes, we should never know it was dark. Dark would be without meaning."
-C.S. Lewis

author: HigherPhoto

text:
@HigherPhoto¬†I believe that chance is the probability of all outcomes and the actual outcome.

The term "luck" as I understand it describes how desirable a certain rare outcome is.

¬†For example, if I were playing the lottery and I got the Jackpot, I would consider that very lucky because it is rare and a very desirable outcome.

If, however, I get the jackpot and then immediately get killed by a lightning strike as the ticket turns to ashes in my hand, I would consider that moderately unlucky since getting struck by lightning is fairly unlikely and it's not a desirable outcome.
author: Ronwe TheFallen

text: @Ronwe TheFallen¬†chance is simply an expression of unkown data. ¬†If all the data, all the variables were know, the chances of the prediction of the outcome would always be 100%. ¬†True randomness has yet to be observed in science therefore the word luck is meaningless. ¬†What we observe is that there is a cause behind everything. ¬†Just because we haven't all the understanding and data of the causes doesn't change this. ¬†Luck, chance and randomness really are meaningless terms. ¬†¬†
author: HigherPhoto
Ronwe TheFallen

text:
@Ronwe TheFallen¬†So far as quantum physics goes, the very fact that you "observed" the particle which "caused" it to change behavior, negates the idea it's random. ¬†If you must do something to get something to happen, not random. ¬†Just because we lack the knowledge or data that expresses the reason why the particle did something different when "observed", doesn't give us the right to call it true randomness. ¬†Eventually we'll gain more knowledge and then realize the forces that caused the behavior change. ¬†

1 in 52 is an expression of the amount of data the card drawer lacks. ¬†With more data, the probability goes down. ¬†

You see, what we DO observe in the universe is that EVERYTHING happens for a reason. ¬†This is something science has yet to disprove. ¬†

Something caused the card drawer to decide to draw the card, something caused a genetic mutation in the boy in this video. ¬†Something caused us to have this civil discussion. ¬†

Something cause the world to come into existence (based on the fact that we observe cause with everything else). ¬†

Everything happens for a reason and every result, first had a cause. ¬† ¬†¬†

text:
Kelly Knight, I'm sorry, but what you just said is stupid. I know this is 2 months old, but I have to say something. We'll do it in steps shall we.
1. The bible was written thousands of years ago, it has a long history with humans, simple enough to accept, why, because we can date back all the scriptures for thousands of years. Simple concept.¬†
2. The bible, is not about 'real events' always. I mean, seriously, you can't truly use the bible as evidence for anything because it's not verified. We only use unverified evidence if it's the only option, like in history we only have a few scriptures and paintings to prove the Battle of Hastings for example, but in this case, when you're making an absurd comment about a magical unicorn, you have to give good evidence.
3. Forgive me if I misunderstood, but you seem to be using a size matter argument So, because most of the people in Germany at one point were Nazis it is a more valid belief? One man create viable theories, and they can still be correct. If that wasn't true, we wouldn't have all the amazing inventions we have today, made by one man.¬†
4. This is where you start to annoy me. First, scientists 100 times more intelligent than you would say otherwise, just saying, you can't make a final statement without that as evidently you have no real understanding of evolution. Evolution is a scientific theory, essentially a fact, god is just a theory, but so is the spaghetti monster. a. DO NOT GENERALIZE ATHEISTS, some atheist don't believe in evolution, some do, but all atheism is, is not believing in a god. b. You probably don't know this, but there are literally hundreds of bones found in specific places that we'd expect, mapping out the entirety of what we call evolution for primates Ok. We evolved from a common ancestor of 'apes', and we are all primates. Ok, that is at the very least a proven fact, do you know why, genetics. We can map out the genetics, see the differences between species, and find physical bones to prove that some kind of change happened. Also, its random, but not in that way. It's like, you have millions of parts of your genome that are different from your parents, and if it is big enough we call it a mutation, and mutations can be built up and make different creatures etc, it's a lot more complicated than that, but you get the gist. This takes millions of years mind you. Bye the way, this essentially wont happen with humans, because creatures that can't get enough food with a specific mutation die, and that's why it's survival of the fittest, but something like this wouldn't occur for humans because we can easily attain food and we are too spread out across the world, i.e., creatures wont evolve the same way by default.
5. No-one thinks they're so high and mighty, but when you start saying things like this, it makes me feel, fairly good, I'm not going to lie. You are no better than an atheist and we are no better than you. We're all humans, and what you're doing is essentially discrimination.¬†
6. We didn't start as a molecules lol. There were tests, the Miller Urey experiment for example, that proved life can start on it's own, from there as I said, millions of years pass by and these amino acids, as they start, and later prokeryotic, then eukeryotic cells, built up into big structures, and these big structures are what we can at least call fish ok. Remember, this took millions of years, and they were not modern day fish. btw, it is also scientifically proven that humans only arrived recently in the earths history, so we are pretty insignificant to be honest. Also, they didn't just grow legs, ever over millions of years they had mutations that eventually could be prominently seen as legs, similar to how we still have a tail bone, like all primates, or 'monkey' like creatures, but we have lost the full tail, over a LONG time, because we didn't need it anymore.¬†
7. Last but not least, a. we've already covered, don't generalize, the reason I¬†
am writing this is because I am actually pained by what you said, the lack of knowledge in your statement, I am not a know it all looking to harm you or your beliefs in any way, I just hat it when people make incorrect claims. b. Have a good day :)

author: Moetassim Rady

text:
Excuse me, atheists. This is from a website called http://www.chaim.org/atheist.htm. This guy is a former atheist. If you have so much reliability on science without using any in your own lives, how can you say a christian is a lunatic? You rely on something, we rely on someone. No atheist can say they don't rely on anybody or anything. This is from the website i mentioned before.¬†
So you're an atheist. Mazel Tov, at least you aren't wishy washy. As a former atheist myself, I won't condemn you. How could I? Some atheists think they've taken a heroic stand, but could it be that they really don't want to face up to the possibility that God is indeed there? I hope you'll be intellectually honest enough to consider what I have to say and see if it makes sense.

No one who has prejudged an issue can be convinced of anything contrary to what he wants to believe. There are still those who insist the earth is flat and no one can convince them otherwise, no matter what the evidence. There are always folks, no matter if religious or atheistic, who stubbornly believe what they prefer, no matter if reason and fact show otherwise. Someone like this has the unspoken philosophy: Don't confuse me with the facts. My mind is already made up. Ask yourself: Am I open-minded or narrow minded? Am I willing to change my mind if I can be shown atheism doesn't make sense?

You might say, If God is there, let him prove it to me. I don't want to take an irrational leap of faith. Fine. In Isaiah 2:18 God says: come let us reason together. He wants us to reason and He certainly wants us to be be rational, but He will not submit himself to human scrutiny; to do so he would need to stop being God! He will not bow to our perverse judgements. Ask yourself, Would I ever be willing to believe God is there, however strong the evidence? You see, your problem may not be in your head as much as in your heart. Perhaps you've already taken a leap of faith. To assert God cannot exist, despite the impossibility of proving that statement, is the ultimate irrational leap!Atheism tends to exalt reason, but it is actually irrational. Atheists tend to put a lot of stock in the emperical method and in logic. One cannot disprove God exists using the emperical method. You might reply: But I can't disprove a giant purple frog on Mars controls the universe, either. Granted, one can never disprove any given thing exists. The atheistic position denying God's existence, if based on the emperical method, is absurd. Why do I say that? ¬†In order to prove the assertion No God exists experimentally, one would need to comprehensively know all of reality. Comprehensive knowledge of reality is called omniscience. One would need to be omniscient in order to prove there is no God, but if one were omniscient one would, by definition, already be God! ¬†So, based on emperical methodology, the only one capable of disproving the existence of God would be God himself! ¬†But some would say you can indeed assert something does not exist if its existence is logically self contradictory, such as a square triangle. ¬†By definition it cannot exist. ¬†It is illogical for something to be a square and to also be a triangle. Again, granted, but this line of reasoning assumes logic and real meaning exist and are our basis for knowledge --something an atheist has no right to assert! The existence of God is not only logically possible, it is philosophically essential. (We'll get to that more later below.) One cannot prove logic exists unless one first presupposes a God in whom reason and meaning are transcendentally rooted, otherwise these categories are mere philosphical prejuduces. Atheism is inherently self-contradictory. The evidence for the existence of God is there for all to see, only we refuse to see it. King David wrote: The fool says in his heart there is no God. (Psalm 14:1) ¬†In other words, Atheism is irrational. Apart from God there is no basis for truth or ethics. For the sake of brevity, let's simply consider ethics.
I think thats enough for one comment, read more on that site under disproving atheism.

text: @Kelly Knight¬†The 'topic' is an amazing boy who did amazing things, and should be thanked. End of story. God doesn't really matter in this instance, it's the boy. Also, I never try to disprove religion, I may merely say that there is no evidence for it. That doesn't mean that it isn't real, just that I currently don't want to believe it until I'm shown the evidence. I don't think God doesn't exist, but I don't think he does either. I just don't think you can believe something, or disprove something, without evidence for each, which there is neither of. I guess that makes me an agnostic atheist. Have a nice day :)
author: Davis Moniz

text:
@Kelly Knight¬†Also, I took the time to read the points on the page. Atheism, as far as I know, doesn't not claim to know God doesn't exist. Nor does it say that you can disprove something with empirical evidence. It basically states a statement will remain a statement until it is proved, God possibly being the statement. Still I am not saying God doesn't exist, merely there is no evidence to support his existence. The other issue I had with the article was morality. In case you don't know, morality is something we share as humans, and, to a lesser extent, more primitive animals are moral as well. They have laws, like don't kill from their own pack, and don't steak food etc. This is because it's a logical think to do. There is, at least to the human mind, a point in being moral. In the long run, it's all down to what your mind thinks. You don't NEED a 'holy book' to be moral. Although it can help some people. If anything, the bible actually taught me the opposite of morality, as I opposed to being scared - with hell - into being good. I just wanted to be good. Have a nice day :)¬†
P.S. If you sincerely want me to address the other points I will.

Put it this way, I don't believe in God because it takes evidence for me to believe in something, and there is subsequently no evidence for God. However, that's not to say he can't exist. Think of quantum tunneling, there was a time where it seemed like an impossibility. Where someone like Einstein couldn't even wrap his head around it. Why? Because there was no evidence. That made i impossible to believe. However, it happened to be real eventually, and we now have empirical evidence for it. There is currently no empirical evidence for God, so some people will use faith, which I have NO problem with. However, you could say the same about mythical creatures. No to say God is mythical, I'm trying really hard not to offend you, but they are on the same grounds in terms of evidence. Feel free to argue against this. Thanks, have a nice day :)

text:
@Kelly Knight
¬†You have the right to be offended and everyone has the right to offend. This is also the underlying principle of free speech.

All religions are a joke, yours included. People who believe in a personal god or claim to know of a god are delusional. No different to those claiming Elvis is still alive. We need evidence to take your claims seriously and no, a 2000 year old book is not good enough to be considered evidence, in the same way spider man comic books are not sufficient evidence to prove the actual existence of spider man.

There are a million, billion, trillion, (insert number here) other claims, far less controversial, so trivial that you could propose to me but that I still wouldn't be able to believe in on the effective basis of "I saw it and you've got to believe me". That's called faith and faith is believing in things without evidence and without good justification. Faith is also indistinguishable from gullibility.

People who have "faith" are basically uncomfortable with admitting their ignorance. In the quest to feel less bad about their ignorance, they fill in their black holes of ignorance with unknowable facts/truths. And when those unknowable facts/truths are unknowingly fallacious beliefs, it permits otherwise perfectly good people to think and do bad things whilst sincerely believing them to be good.

text:
@*****¬†Its a fine line... Depression is a serious state, and can be caused by many different inherent and external hardships.. (weather they be physical or physiological) All forms of depression are real... Irrelevant of the reason. Depression can seriously effect and eat away at a persons life.

But we can do something about all forms of depression. Weather that entails, phsychology, change of outlook, dealing with issues, time, or medical drugs.
author: Lyk

text:
@*****¬†Again you are simplifying it... Chemical proccesses are influenced by external environment... Just like Stress can increase your propensity to have a heart attack...¬†

Its a combination. A balance. Sometimes more of the one, or other..

Sometimes people can deal with the most serious of events, and sometimes it takes something 'seemingly' (to the outside world) insignificant to put somebody into depression, however it may have been several 'catastrophic' occurrences (for the individual) that he may have not been able to deal with.

The fact that the rest of the world may see it as insignificant and it is worrying the depressed indivudual so much, may only add to his depression. He feels inaduaqaute and insecure...

People are diagnosed with chemical imbalances like bipolar disorder... But let us remember that often their is an inherent cause to this... Drugs to remedy can be the 'correct' form of treatment, however can aslo be an ad-hoc treatment, and that they are not dealing with the external modivators that have 'caused' the imbalance.

A big part of it for example like the heart attack, can be stress induced. Bad coping mechanisms. The individual could have been a perfectionist, or the best in his class and is now struggling to cope for example in an ivy league university (You would have thought you would be happy being at Harvard?)..

You could say Cancer is congenital... Partly it may be... But our external environment and what we do to our bodies also influences the biology..

I'm so sorry that you've been feeling down, ¬†it's an awful feeling to carry all the time. text: I hate that. Don't feel like a piece of shit for being depressed. You're allowed to feel sad, too. Just because you may not have the same disease that this boy has does not mean that you can't have a bad day every once in a while. I hate when people say "people have it worst than you." like .. okay is that supposed to make us feel better? that really pisses me off. It's like saying "you can't be happy because other's have it better than you." No. Just no. No one knows what's going on with you. Who care's if your life appears to be better than someone else's? That doesn't mean you don't have your own personal problems to deal with. If you've been diagnosed with depression, it's not something you can just "suck up" it's a real mental illness and that's not good. I mean, it's good that you feel like you can overcome whatever is bringing you down, and if you did, thats great!! But don't just try to hide it and keep everything bottled up inside. Don't be scared of what others might think of you. Who cares if they think you're a shitty person? Again, they don't know whats going on in your personal life. They have NO room to judge you. Sorry, I kinda went on this rant, i'm just very passionate about this subject. And i've been through the same thing except i've actually had people tell me that i'm ungrateful and selfish because i'm sad. It really sucks and no one should have to go through that. At all. Have a great day. :)

text:
@Steven Bachelier

"If the purpose of God is to inspire men to feel compassion for their fellow man, then this person accomplishes that purpose."

This reminds me of how I often hear religious parents explain their disabled child's existence through God's plan to teach the parents a lesson, or even punish them for something they did. I get the creeps from that, I hope you understand why.

This is a human life we are talking about - It should be treated valuable as a given, for the mere fact it exists. Certainly a disabled or ill child's existence should never be valued as a tool for teaching us able-bodied persons to live better lives. Their existence is hard enough, so the least we can do is give them the right to exist without an excuse. If anything, we exist for them, not the other way around.

@Esteban Clouthier Gastelum¬†Thats a lot of very touching prose, really. And im sure its much easier to philosophize when you dont have a condition like this.

Yeah- I agree. Theres is no "meaning" to life. However Im working within the framework of those who so often chime in regarding stories like this- which are the "True Believers".

The fact is that we have one short length of time here. And it pains me to see suffering-especially of children- when there are others praising a creator who they fully believe inflicted his condition on him intentionally.¬†

If I have one talent, its that i tune into the feelings of others extremely well. Human beings learn to make sense of their condition. They learn to find meaning in suffering. I get the sense that this kid was far from happy though.¬†

text:
@Silent Box¬†Please remember that when you become a quadriplegic. It'll just be more opportunity to smile.¬†

Its pretty clear he still hasnt fully accepted "God's plan" for him, since he talks about keeping a pair of shoes in his closet. He also still happens to be alive, so thats a pretty important distinction...

I didnt say that disabled people can't be happy. I said that anyone that believes in an all powerful God would have to be a moron to contend that this is God's perfect creation.

Human beings can learn to live with anything, but to give this incredibly rare disease to a CHILD. To make him an outsider,to make him sick. To make him suffer...and for what? Its just incredibly messed up.

text:
@David Merlin¬†You people are so dense.¬†

Atheism isn't a belief. Its a absence of belief, for lack of evidence. You believe the earth is 6000 years old because a book told you so.

My belief is in truth, in things which can be proven, which have evidence. I dont choose blind faith because i believe in something higher than sheepish obedience.

I withhold my belief for the same reason that you wouldnt pray for God to protect you and then jump off the grand canyon. Deep down, you know he doesn't exist. You know that theres no way you can tangibly prove that he does. Youve lived the lie so long though, that it becomes a threat to change your way of thinking, and so youve become intent to see it through to its conclusion, in hopes that somehow youll be vindicated in the end. ¬†

Please prove how Allah and Zeus dont exist.

Theres literally more proof for bigfoot and 2-story-tall crocodiles than there is for your christian god.¬†

Conversation over.

author: Random Panda

text:
@westcoastOGee 

"Holy fuck. Sacred, reverent fuck. That made no. no. no. no. Sense."

Why?

"Its like those people who say that god put fossils in the ground to test our faith."

No. These are two different cases. 

What you're saying essentially is "Sure it doesn't make any sense but you just have to believe it anyway."

No. What I'm saying is: Either God doesn't exist or he's purposely hiding, as in, not proving himself. 
Can you agree that these are the only two possible cases?

If so, and it's only logical, you seem to lack the insight to follow me.

"Hes hiding himself on purpose? What kind of garbage is that?"

Why is it garbage? I explained it here already, yet you ignored it:
If you don't have the will to believe in him you will never truly believe in him, evidence or not. You have to want it and that's where true faith begins. The thing is that you have to open your eyes to see the light. That's something god can't do for you. So stop demanding evidence, the second you want to believe is also the second where you realize you don't need proof. 
This is the only way we can truly connect with God. Not because we are impressed by his power. Not because everyone does. Not because he's superior to us. No, this is on an equivalent level, and only based upon that we will be able to truly love him. Take the billionaire that disguises himself as a beggar so that the people he meets aren't nice to him because he's a billionaire but because of his character.
I'm afraid you won't understand, no matter how often I explain it. Our views and experiences differ too much.

"What kind of hocus-pocus prankster Houdini God does things that way, especially when the stakes of belief are supposedly heaven and hell? Zero sense."

An almost cheesy approach you're taking here. Atheists often degrade one's believe to make it sound more silly. It only shows that they don't understand anything.

While I really don't feel like it right now and while I've written this about ten times already, here we go:

Dante's divine Comedy is said to be the most influential book of the medieval times, only topped of course, by the bible. But still, this pagan's book altered hell for ever. The first image of hell we have in mind is that of Dante Alighieri. 

Before that, the associations with hell were very different. Actually, what has been translated as hell was not even one, but three words: Sheol, Hades and, if I recall it correctly, Gehenna. Just to show how much has changed. 

Dante's version of hell wasn't based upon the actual source, it was a free interpretation of how Dante thought hell would be.

And now to the actual argument: I believe that, should a person want to leave hell, he could. However, all that the person wants is to sin: he wants to take drugs, he wants to have sex and so on. The sins that filled his life are still with him in his death, and since he doesn't accept God's help because he wants the sin instead, he is trapped in his very own hell forever.

That is also explains how hell is worse for one than another since a person that craves for more obviously lacks and thus suffers more. 
Even if God (and I believe he does) were to offer him paradise, he would deny it as he only sees the sin.Ôªø 
That still doesn't mean hell isn't a pit of fire, but it's the sin that keeps one there.

"Its like buying a car and having someone say you just need to believe that there are airbags, refusing to tell you yes or no."

And here again, you don't understand. If the seller says yes, it's still up to you to believe him. But this is an unfitting example.

"If he wants us to "search for him", then why would he have such an issue with showing himself? lol."

So I was right when I said that you wouldn't understand. You don't even try to. Start trusting God and he will answer you. The more you begin loving, the more he will come over you. But to you as an atheist, these are meaningless words.

"As it stands, theres as much evidence for his existence as there is for Vishnu, Zeus, or the easter bunny. And at least Zeus has lightning bolts and a sweet toga.Ôªø"

And there will never be evidence, and no human technology will ever be able to measure him. If it could, it could also tell where God is and where he's not and thus limit him.

The only way to stay sane is to find meaning in your suffering. Its what we do.

My comment> Of course, no one is disputing that it's very unfortunate for this kid to be sick, and of course he is not happy that he has it.¬† All I was saying is, it does not seem like your speculation is true, ie"... this little guy was just reciting lines pretty much....things that every old/ terminally ill person says, to validate their life somewhat."¬†¬†¬† This guy shows a perspective of life that many never get to (probably including myself); certainly not every old person dying has attained that perspective

All kinds of unfortunate things happen to people, but it does not mean they cannot be happy and still find a way to have a fulfilling life.¬†¬† Everyone has a choice and responsibility in how they react to bad things that happen to them.¬†¬† From what little I can see in this video, this kid has made a choice to not let this disease prevent him from living his life to the fullest possible for him.¬† Looking at how he chuckles, how he fights to be the marching band, how he spends time with his "geeky" friends, how he acknowledge both the good and bad in life, .... he seem to genuinely LIVING a happy life, not just saying the words.¬†¬†¬†

Of course, everything I know about him is from this video.¬† That's obviously not a lot.¬†¬† So above is just my speculation, ie, what I can tell, I think he's living the talk and he is happy.¬† Then again, your comment and views are just speculations also, correct?

text:
@MexicanChimpanZ

1. Clearly YOU care.

2. You religious folk just LOVE to play the victim. No one is BASHING anything. Simply pointing out inconsistencies. If that "strikes" you as violent oppression, youre going to have a very uncomfortable existence, indeed.

3. Biology is a branch of scientific study, and it's not a theory. What does that even mean- you "like" them? If youd studied sciences at even the most fundamental levels, youd realize that faith and reason are mutually exclusive. Theyre just not compatible. You're not stupid. Its time to stop riding the fence. So you know that heaven doesn't exist, but you want to believe that it does because it gives you comfort? You're free to believe however you want, but just realize that's INSANE. Thats like ignoring the parking ticket under your windshield wiper because you dont want to deal with the stress of having to pay a fine.... or like keeping your dead wife's corpse seated at the kitchen table because pretending that shes still alive is easier than dealing with the reality. Its just insanity. Believing what makes you happy is all well and good, but having such a huge portion of our planet so out of touch with reality is really a detriment to us all.¬†

4. That analogy is COMPLETELY off. Homosexuality is- as far as we can tell- a genetic/psychological, sexual trait that affects that person and that person only. Religion isnt IMMORAL...but it is incorrect. Religion/God is a contstruct- an antiquated belief system concocted from a grab-bag of different faux-pas and rituals. In thousands of years of human history, He has yet to uncover so much as a shred of verifiable proof of his existence. Religion holds itself above critique or ridicule, and the faithful hold it as a point of pride that their faith needs no reason or proof to back it up. Religion has been the direct cause of hundreds of thousands of deaths, and the indirect cause of millions more. Religious Dogma worms its way into the lives of everyone, religious or not. And if you believe that telling a gay person that their lifestyle is wrong- is in and of itself wrong- then youve indicted religion already. Thats EXACTLY what religion does. So yes, it is stupid. Its a huge portion of everything wrong with the world. It makes people hateful. It keeps people stupid. It keeps people in control. It squashes intelligence and creativity. It limits our potential.¬†

You arent stupid. Its time to get rid of the security blanket. Its time to grow out of these old ways of thinking and step into a world of freedom and possibility and harmony.

If God can do all those things, then I dont understand why he would create people broken and hurting. Why he would allow children to die and starve. Why he would create curiosity and intellect and reason, and then expect me to ignore all of those things...at the cost of my immortal soul?¬†

It just makes zero sense to me. ¬†I want that boy to be well and whole NOW. I dont want his family to have to have buried their son.¬†

text:
@Miguel Angel Lopez¬†IM making assumptions based on the fact that the kid had al illness that killed him at the age of 18. Thats like saying im making an ASSUMPTION that a person whose entire family died in a fire was massively depressed.¬†

He had an illness. An illness that killed him. Unless he was an incredibly abnormal person, or under the influence of some pretty extreme mood-altering medications, it stands to reason that he wasn't exactly thrilled about his condition and his prospects. This is not rocket science. And frankly even if he was as happy as a clam, it makes no difference to the subject at hand.¬†

And ""leaves you in a problem of having to be honest"? Lol. About what? Your argument is "God did it". I dont even know what youre referring to. Presupposing what? That love is real, and exists? That a God would be a loving god? What?

I dont think that love "exists". Love is a behavior. It no more needs an explanation and a creator than do the hundreds of other complex emotions and reactions humans exhibit. God is no more responsibly for "love" than for anxiety, greed or lust.Theyre just instinctual, chemical, electrical reactions. Its no mistake that the people we "love" most are typically close friends and family. Its been proven that altruism has evolutionary usefulness.

I wasnt arguing against God. I have no need to argue against that which I have no reason whatsoever to be concerned with. I just get very angry with people taht continue to talk about how omnipotent, merciful, loving, etc- their God is, while "he" is creating people like this kid. Those things dont jive.

text:
@Olivia Connolly¬†Technically I dont blame it on God, because I have zero proof of his existence. I "blame" him like I blame the Easter Bunny for stubbing my toe.

¬†If I did believe though, Id have to be pretty angry. I was under the impression that everything in existence was the result of his creation or inspiration. Did he not design the human body and genetic code down to its last infinitesimally minute detail? So too then did he create cancer, progeria, alzheimers, MS, ¬†ALS, etc. Though when discussing with believers, these things are all conveniently out of the hands of the being who they believe is responsible for....everything else.

And number one- the AVERAGE life span is just that...AVERAGE. It doesnt mean that a person can't live a shorter or longer time than that average. And if God was responsible for giving him an "extra" 4 years, why not give him an extra 20?! 30? ¬†60? ¬†How about just letting him live out his life and die an old man, with his children around him? The fuck do you know about fair? How fair is it for a father with 100 children to give tons of money to 8 or 10 of them, a little bit of money to 60 of them, and nothing to the rest? Tell me how its FAIR that someone be born with a debilitating illness that totally screws up their quality of life, and then dies before theyre even old enough to buy a beer? How is it FAIR that 6 year olds die of brain tumors? How FAIR is it that some children are sitting in their expensive private school ¬†fingerpainting while another child across the globe the exact same age is starving to death? Dont try to tell me what isnt fair.

I feel silly even having a discussion about an invisible sky wizard, but I dont think its UNFAIR to expect the all powerful creator of the universe to create people strong and whole, happy, successful, loving, kind. ¬†

text:
@Olivia Connolly¬†Invisible sky wizard? Im sorrry does that sound outlandish? Im not sure what else to call an invisible, all knowing, all seeing, all-powerful creator of the universe who sends storms of frogs and locusts, turns water into wine, spits in dirt to make magical clay, makes magical trees and clones human beings out of ribs.... I think wizard is a pretty apt description.

Dont give me that "everything happens for a reason" bullshit. One- its fucking stupid because of COURSE everything happens for a reason. Thats the nature of existence. Things happens as the result of things occurring before them. Second- Thats the go-to excuse for people to cover for the fact that "god" has no power whatsoever to control or create anything. Id like to see how eager youd be to tell a friend who told you they were just raped that "everything happens for a reason". Lets find a silver lining in that sexual assault. Maybe thats just gods way of trying to make you a stronger person? Sounds reasonable. ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†

And again...AGAIN...i dont blame it on God...because he doesnt exist. I dont blame it on anyone. This was really just my way of saying "This is proof that all you people who rejoice in how great and loving God is- are misguided or outright stupid. This means one of 3 things. Either God doesnt exist, or he exists and has no control over anything, or he has control and simply doesnt care about any of you." It was a rare disease caused by the perfect storm of genetic abnormality on both his mothers and father's sides. However if I did believe in a supreme, omnipotent, all-knowing director of all in creation, i would have to level the blame squarely at...the guy running the show.

Sam is not in a better place. Sam is no place, He doesn't exist anymore, and his body is in the ground... which is really sad because he seemed like he wouldve been a wonderful, thoughful adult- the kind this world needs more of.¬†

Many people do not have the drive this kid has. And honestly, he perhaps would not have had this drive if he wasn't stricken with his "defect". Everyone knows a person who has no drive, be it themselves, or a lazy friend or uncle. This kid got drive. That's what matters to him. Not to other people, but to just him. That's how it should be.

God is a spiritual being, he's not going to turn on the lights if you ask him to turn on the lights. You have arms and legs go turn on the light yourself. He gave you a body to interact with physical things.¬†

So if you ask him to heal someone, he's not going to flip a switch and they're better. If you are praying from the heart with true intent and faith, he'll guide you to healing. You might hear a "still small voice" (as they say in church a lot), which means just a soft prompting to do something. And over time you get better at listening to the promptings of the spirit. So he might guide you to give the sick guy water because he was just dehydrated, or if he has cancer, use medical cannabis to kill it or aid in the recovery of it. text: Whatever somebody decides to do when they are high off weed was beside my point. You dont have to get high to do anything or change the world. My point is based off of research. Smoking weed doesn't make anyone any less smart but research shows that it interferes with natural chemicals in the body such as the flight or fight response time. And it can be long term. It also makes sense since everyone who smokes can relate to the two most common effects which are sleepy and hungry. Also it does not aid in natural dopamine production.  When someone gets high their natural dopamine production stops when it reaches a certain level of production. When the high wears off it causes that down or crash feeling. Since the chemicals in ur brain dont know that your getting high its actually gonna slow ur natural dopamine production when ur sober. This is when addiction kicks in bc now in order for your brain to produce enough dopamine for you to get that same feel good feeling you would have to get high again. I know i just said alot lol you dont have to take my word for it the information is out there if you wanna research it more in depth. I studied nursing for a while and this was a study that I found on the effects of substances on the brain. The study was originally done on cocaine users and based on the study, the brains of many coke heads dont even produce dopamine naturally once they're full fledged fiends. Personally im not against it im not condemning it like i said i did it back then, I just like to research its interesting stuff.
